Author: radix42#3743
Content: @Alright @daemonfox yes you can indeed run Komodo on arm processors, so long as it is an arm v8/aarch64!! I'm doing it right now!

Author: radix42#3743
Content: see my personal site at https://janemercer.us for link to latest binary build and source

Author: radix42#3743
Content: and no, I don't care what the latest raspberry pi 3B+ says, it doesn't have all the crypto extensions licensed for arm v8 so get that thought out of your head right now üòÉ

Author: radix42#3743
Content: but anything that runs armbian and has enough ram should run my build

Author: radix42#3743
Content: I'm running it on a Debian Jessie instance in the cloud (where it got built!) and on my https://nodl.it that has a Rock64 processor

Author: radix42#3743
Content:
I'd one of these rather than a pi: https://www.pine64.org/?page_id=7147
$45 for the 4 gig ram version, can run komodo unlike the latest Pi, and is compatible with all the pi cases and shields and accessories, @daemonfox !!!!

Author: radix42#3743
Content: slap Armbian linux on that sucker and off to the races

Author: radix42#3743
Content: I'm running KMD and $ARRR on my arm v8 node right now

Author: radix42#3743
Content: AND bitcoin core and monero all at the same time, but that's on a nodl.it which is a very burly ARM64 box

Content: yeah, 'oh its got a Cortex A53, its 64 bit' and you fools didn't pay extra to ARM to license all the crypto shit in HW and your OS is still 32 bit and never activates what 64 bit features the processor DOES have

Author: radix42#3743
Content: just....just go and buy the best Rasp Pi form factor board from Pine64 you can afford is my advice to anyone wanting to build their own Komodo/z-anything nodes

Author: radix42#3743
Content: they'll never run on Raspberry Pi's unless/until some future one has a REAL 64 bit processor and OS, and competing boards that do are like 10 bucks more so *shrug emoji*
